intro: Amblostima, commonly known as the creeping jenny, is a low-growing perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves and spreads by rhizomes, forming dense mats. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Amblostima is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to stabilize soil in wetlands.
